result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candace Marie Jones

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cover letter enclosing documents. Filed by Atty. Harrelson. kma

Adjustment Number: 22A 111300,
Payable Number: 246392,
Receipt Number: 22R 014895,
Amount: $20.00

$500 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jeremy J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:26 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker appeared.  Jeremiah Harrelson appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Candace Marie Jones in court. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. NG. Bond argument; bond ordered. DE requests next hearing in 90 days to allow time to retain Atty Bosworth. Court sets PSC.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
